title: SDE5402 Carbon Accounting and Markets | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Explore carbon accounting fundamentals, methodologies, and frameworks, focusing on ESG applications and GHG emissions reporting aligned with global standards like the Greenhouse Gas Protocol.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Explore carbon accounting fundamentals, methodologies, and frameworks, focusing on ESG applications and GHG emissions reporting aligned with global standards like the Greenhouse Gas Protocol.

Sustainability has increasing mandates across all industries and professions and at the national level. Starting in April 2025, all listed companies on the Singapore Exchange will have to make climate disclosures, and this will also apply to large non-listed companies. As a result, there will be a ripple effect across associated companies, professions, and supply chains.

This module introduces the fundamental concepts, methodologies, and frameworks of carbon accounting, with a focus on its application to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) metrics. It aims to equip learners with the skills to quantify and report greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in accordance with global standards such as the Greenhouse Gas Protocol.
By integrating local and global perspectives, the module covers carbon accounting in industries like energy, transportation, and healthcare while critically examining its role in ESG reporting.
This module is part of the Graduate Certificate in Sustainability (GCert in Sust PP) and supports the
Learners who are seeking to enhance their expertise in environmental sustainability across diverse industry sectors, including sustainability officers, policymakers, managers, and business owners.
For learners who are not pursuing Engineering Sustainability Chartership:
A Bachelor's degree from a recognised university
For learners who are pursuing Engineering Sustainability Chartership:
An engineering degree or an equivalent qualification recognised by the Professional Engineers Board Singapore (PEB)
A STEM-based degree meeting the Chartered Engineer (CEng) qualification requirements (IES chapter) and seek CEng accreditation
Understand the principles and definitions of Greenhouse Gas (GHG) inventories and scopes of emissions
Understand the standards and protocols of GHG and ISO 14064
Learn about carbon offsets, renewable energy credits, and their implications
Explore the integration of ESG metrics into sustainability reporting
Explore frameworks such as the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) and the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD)
Examine the role of carbon accounting in achieving net-zero goals
Learn how to prepare a GHG Inventory
Utilise carbon footprint calculators and conduct lifecycle assessments (LCA)
Explore technology applications such as AI, IoT, and blockchain in emissions tracking
Examine Singapore’s carbon tax and sustainability frameworks (e.g., Green Plan 2030).
Analyse global initiatives such as the EU ETS, Paris Agreement targets, and SEC climate disclosures
Case Studies – Analyse local and global carbon accounting initiatives
Analyse the integration of carbon accounting in ESG reporting
Examine the use of digital platforms for emissions tracking
Explore internal carbon fee and decarbonisation strategy
Assess lifecycle emissions accounting in product manufacturing
Evaluate Scope 3 emissions disclosure and carbon offset strategies in energy transition efforts
Upon completion of this module, learners are able to:
Explain the principles and methodologies of carbon accounting, including Scopes 1, 2, and 3
Analyse the integration of carbon accounting into ESG reporting frameworks
Evaluate the efficacy of carbon reduction strategies in organisational contexts
Apply carbon accounting tools to measure and report emissions for various industries
Identify from case studies, best practices and challenges in carbon accounting
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Business, Communication and Design, Singapore Institute of Technology

Ricci specialises and teaches in financial accounting and accounting standards. She obtained her PhD in Accountancy from RMIT University. Ricci is a member of Certified Practising Accountant (CPA) Australia. She is also a committee member for the Sustainability Reporting Education Working Group under the Corporate Reporting Committee of ISCA, an external reviewer for the Singapore CA Qualification (Foundation), and an examination marker for Singapore CA Qualification.
Assistant Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Hu Chengcheng has over 10 years of experience in sustainability research and practice, working with diverse stakeholders—including government agencies and industry sectors such as manufacturing, technology, finance, food, and oil & gas—to translate strategy into action. As a subject matter expert in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), she helps clients understand and reduce the carbon footprints of their products and services. Her expertise spans a wide range of domains, including product sustainability, carbon finance, circular economy, sustainable supply chains, carbon accounting and reporting, assurance, and regulatory research and strategy development related to sustainability. Chengcheng holds a PhD in Environmental Engineering from Nanyang Technological University (NTU), supported by the prestigious NRF Clean Energy Scholarship. She has also earned global sustainability certifications from leading institutions such as Cambridge and DTU, and holds the Advanced Certificate in Learning and Performance (ACLP) from WSQ.
Explore Case Studies – Analyse local and global carbon accounting initiatives (Part 1)
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 3 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Graduate Certificate in Sustainability Principles and Practices
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
Learners will have to complete a project assignment.
The full fee for this course is S$3,597.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Graduate Certificate in Sustainability Principles and Practices is designed to equip professionals with the sustainability-related expertise to navigate industry demands, regulatory shifts, and sustainability challenges in the evolving landscape.

With the maritime industry turning to lower carbon fuels and energy-efficient technologies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, the Masterclass in Maritime Decarbonisation offered by SIT steers knowledge acquisition in this direction.
Helping SMEs Embed Sustainability in Business

Co-developed with the Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (ASME), the ‘Introduction to Sustainability for Businesses’ course provides companies with the knowledge and frameworks for mapping their sustainability goals.

Is learning new skills still relevant after 40? This was the question Resendos faced while contemplating taking up a postgraduate certificate course at SIT. His decision to constantly upskill himself shaped his entrepreneurial journey.
Business Management, Design Innovation, Career Growth and Transition
Lifelong Learning - Upskill with SITizens Learning Credits

To grow professionally, lifelong learning is practically a must when adapting in today’s VUCA world. As a graduate from Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), how can you make use of the resources on hand to progress in your career?
Business Management, Career Growth and Transition

Explore elements that contribute to sustainable and resilient data centres, focusing on innovative technologies and strategies that ensure business continuity and minimise downtime during disruptions.
Building Services, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Executive Education
Agile Orientation for Digital Transformation: Concepts, Practices and Mindsets
Master Agile methodology in this 2-day course. Gain theory, practical skills, and toolkits for real-world implementation and success
District Cooling Systems: Technologies, Components, and Sustainable Engineering
Learn the fundamentals of district cooling systems, including technologies, engineering principles, and sustainability strategies, to optimise efficiency and minimise environmental impact.
Sustainability, Energy Efficiency, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering
Green Transformation with Sustainability Excellence Associate (SEA) and B Corp Certification Process
Master sustainable business practices to boost operational performance, focusing on SEA and B Corp certifications for long-term growth and resilience.
Leadership and Communication, Business Management, Sustainability, Energy Efficiency
Motor Driven Systems, Audit and Analysis
This course covers energy conservation opportunities for motor-driven equipment, including MDS design, system evaluation, and energy management programmes.
Learn essential personal branding skills, overcome career stagnation and create impactful content for career advancement.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
